sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: Launched in May 2015, APY is a central government pension scheme targeting workers in the unorganized sector, guaranteeing monthly pension after age 60.[^10][^11][^12][^13]

sections.title: How the Scheme Works
sections.body:
- Subscribers (age 18–40) make monthly/quarterly/half-yearly contributions until age 60, auto-debited from bank account.
- Offers fixed pension: ₹1,000, ₹2,000, ₹3,000, ₹4,000, or ₹5,000/month based on contribution.[^11][^13]
- Pension is guaranteed by the central government; spouse eligible for pension on death of subscriber. On both deaths, nominee gets corpus.[^14][^15]
- Subscribers can change contribution amount annually.[^11]

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.body:
- Open to all Indian citizens aged 18 to 40 years (cannot be an income tax-payer, as per latest norms).
- Must have a savings/post office account.
- Not covered under any statutory social security scheme.[^13][^16][^17]

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.body:
- Apply via bank or post office holding the savings account.
- Submit APY registration form, along with Aadhaar, mobile number, KYC.
- Contribution auto-debited.
- Nomination available.[^16][^17]

sections.title: Important Points to Note
sections.body:
- Minimum period of contribution: 20 years.
- Co-contribution by government for eligible non-taxpayers who joined scheme between specific early periods.
- Tax benefits under Section 80CCD.
- Withdrawals allowed before 60 only in death/terminal illness cases.[^18][^17]

sections.body:
